column3: Meet Tyus. Lives in Guatamala. Working on his English cause he is immigrating to the US soon.
Meet Barcelona. Big soccer fan. Aspires to be a professional player when she grows up. Inspiring as heck.
Meet Angus. Likes to camouflage as sushi. Stays busy by following his 4-year-old human around.
Meet Rex and Dino. Generally inseparable. Enjoy striking poses whenever possible.
Meet Oscar. Knows he's gorgeous, but that doesn't mean you should pet him. Please go away.
Meet Pistachio. Super adventurous. Preferred mode of transportation is motorcycle. Vroom vroom.
Meet Bella. Slighly self-conscious about her figure, given current snacking habits. Please pet to reassure.
Meet Pippy. Chief Happiness Officer at Khan Academy. Likes to make everyone smile when they come by his desk.
Meet Coco. Plotting to escape your presence. Or murder you in your sleep. Please go away.
Meet Alfie. A gentleman and a scholar. Likes to stare into the distance in deep thought. Please don't disturb.
Meet Bishop and Rouge. Double as a morning alarm clock. No snooze button, so super effective.
Meet Milo. Whatever you're holding belongs to him. Please return, then go away.
Meet Noodles. Mostly harmless, despite internet reputation as a 'danger noodle' or 'nope rope'.
Meet Chester. Often mistaken for a House Elf. Don't worry though, he has a cushy life and doesn't want any clothing.
Meet Oreo. Part time panda and full time napper. Can be found in her dog bed most of the day. Please pet.
Meet Hamlet. Don't know what is a Shakespeare and don't really care to find out.
Meet Missy. Does not like to be photographed. Please go away.
Meet Walter. Professional fluffball. Originally was not allowed on furniture, but owners changed their minds.
Meet Max. Likes to contemplate the horribleness of existence. Please go away.
Meet Mocha. Loves the hoodie. If you have vegetables, please share.
